status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
The upgrade tests fail on the compact2 profile because they use data sources to create databases with old Derby versions, and to shut down the old engines after the test. The data sources in Derby versions before 10.10 require JNDI to be present. Since JNDI is not present on compact2, the attempts to obtain data sources fail:

fields.environment: Java(TM) SE Embedded Runtime Environment (build 1.8.0-ea-b79, profile compact2, headless)

author.name: dagw
author.emailAddress: dag dot wanvik at oracle dot com

comments.body: Can't we skip upgrade tests for cp2 for now, and just populate the old versions dir with old releases (10.10.*) from 10.11 and later?

updateAuthor.name: dagw
updateAuthor.emailAddress: dag dot wanvik at oracle dot com

author.name: knutanders
author.emailAddress: knut dot hatlen at oracle dot com

comments.body:
I agree. Since cp2 is a new platform, it's unlikely that anyone have older Derby versions running on it, so I think it's fine to skip upgrade testing of versions prior to 10.10 on that platform.

The attached patch does that. Committed revision 1453856.

The alternative is to rewrite the upgrade tests to use DriverManager, but I don't think it's worthwhile at the moment.

updateAuthor.name: knutanders
updateAuthor.emailAddress: knut dot hatlen at oracle dot com
